name: Aquarius Casino Resort

reviews.text: We decided to take a last minute trip to Laughlin. We booked a room on line at the Flamingo for $18 a night, What a deal! The service from the valet to the front desk was excellent, we requested a room high up and they gave us one on the top floor with a river view. Overall, the hotel is old and is by no means a 5star resort but it was definately a good time. We took our 4 year old and she loved the pool and gameroom. The hotel is located centerally and is a close walk to outlet mall and theatre along with easy access to the riverwalk. Everyone was very nice and it was clean, what else can you ask for for $18. If you are driving from Las Vegas to Laughlin we highly recommend staying at the Flamingo and on your way don't forget to take Christmas Tree Pass it is a BLAST!
reviews.title: Fun Getaway!
Was a little hesitant at first
reviews.text: I read all of these reports before I left on my trip with my husband and was very weary. My husband and I normally stay in nice hotels and resorts so to read all the bad reviews gave me a bad feeling. HOWEVER, when we arrived it was as if the staff was retrained due to all these bad reviews. Everyone was overly friendly, we had very soft pillows, an alarm clock, a blowdryer, etc. the service both at the buffet and restaurant was good and the bartenders and table hosts were overly friendly. Now being one of the younger couples in Laughlin I did get carded a lot but I took it as a compliment not a burden! :) I would definitley return.

reviews.title: Flamingo Laughlin
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights at the Flamingo Laughlin May 15-17, 2005. Traveled with a group of 50 people from our neighborhood in Scottsdale AZ on a privately chartered motorcoach from Coach USA who made all our arrangements.

reviews.title: An acceptable place to stay
reviews.text: It was a tremendous value for $94 pp including round-trip transportation and double upgraded rooms on the 17th floor with river views.

reviews.title: Disgusting and Terrible
reviews.text: We each enjoyed 2 excellent complimentary buffets at the Flamingo. Used 1 for dinner and 1 for breakfast. The dinner even included free wine! The second evening we went to Harrahs where we had 2 for l coupons for their dinner buffet which cost about $14 pp. It was as good as the Bellagio buffet according to several in our group. Then we had 2 for 1 coupons to see their show, Rhinestone Cowgirls, which would have cost $24.95 pp. It was an incredible show...great dancers, singers and a very clever comedian. Our rooms at the Flamingo were large, clean and attractive and obviously had been refurbished recently. Not a single complaint from 50 people. When has that ever happened? And, most of them are seasoned travelers who have stayed at upscale hotels all over the world. No one could get over the incredible value of this trip. We'll be back!
Laughlin should really not be at the top of anyone's travel itinerary. With that said, I've been to Laughlin dozens of times back in college and now for business meetings.
reviews.title: Best It Gets for Laughlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I gave the Aquarius better than average ratings because it is the best hotel available in the area. I've stayed at just about every one of them, and sadly, they all fair no better than a Holiday Inn off an Interstate in the middle of nowhere.
reviews.title: Rude and Inconsiderate Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Aquarius has been recently remodeled, pretty clean and modern in room appearance. The property used to be the Hilton Flamingo.
reviews.title: THIS PLACE IS A LITTLE BIT OF HEAVEN
Great place in Laughlin
reviews.text: After reading previous postings, especially the one about the property not family-friendly, here is my opinion. Anyone that comes to Laughlin usually is a person interested in gambling. Yes, there is the occasional break to eat and sleep, but for the most part it is a destination for getting down and dirty to gamble. There are no fancy spas, big headliner shows, glitzy nightclubs or world-renowned chef owned restaurants. If you're looking to bring the kiddos in hopes for something "disney-esque", turn-around, drive home and unload the mini-van. The pools are NOT a place to see and be seen, but rather exactly what they were built for 20 years ago, and that is to cool off for a few minutes between rounds at the poker table. Along that note, there are no strip clubs or streetwalkers. The only walkers you'll see are those the elderly folks getting off the tour bus are pushing into the casino.

Bottomline, don't expect to find similiarities between Laughlin and Vegas other than gambling. As for the Aquarius, it's clean, newly renovated, flat screen LCDs in room and great location to casino-hop along the riverwalk. If you're hoping to find something else, it's just a mirage and could probably be found at the Mirage in Vegas.
reviews.title: Not for families and not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aquarius in March 09. It was our fifth stay there. When we first started coming to Laughlin in 2005 it was still the Flamingo and we were always pleased with the room and surroundings. Dated, but rooms were mostly clean and comfortable. Now with the newly remodled rooms we love it. Good location and we've never had a bad view. We like the breakfast buffet with made to order omelets and plenty of other choices. The Aquarius Cafe can sometimes have spotty service but the food is usually decent. There's also Outback Steakhouse and some fast food places. After reading reviews of other hotels in the area, it's obvious a good elevator system is important. There's hardly ever a wait at the Aquarius, even on weekends. When checking in, ask for a room close (but not too close) to the elevators. Check-in has only been slow one time, although I must confess we've always arrived on weekday afternoons. Stay in the adult tower (California) if you aren't traveling with children. The pool area is plain, but we don't use it except to sit in the sun occasionally. There's also three tennis courts. We started coming to Laughlin to get out of Illinois winter weather and we've really enjoyed ourselves every time. Good motel rates and laid back atmosphere. We're in our mid fifties so hustle bustle nightife and entertainment isn't important.
reviews.title: Comfortable, great location

reviews.text: Let me preface my review by saying that Laughlin is not Las Vegas so don't expect it to be. But in actuality, that's what I liked most about it. The rooms in this hotel and clean and new - no plasma tvs, travertine floors or giant sitting areas, but perfectly nice for the price. The beds and bedding are comfy and the casino is spacious and nice (for Laughlin) unlike many of the nearby casinos with their low popcorn ceiling claustrophobia-causing gaming areas. The Aquarius has a good variety of machines and has pai gow poker unlike some of the others that don't. It's not too hard to accumulate comps and the drink service was pretty good as well. The food in the hotel is reasonably priced and this hotel is near enough to other casinos that you can walk anywhere (except Harrah's) if it's not too hot, or take the water taxi (you're right on the river) if you want to venture out for other food options or clubs. The pool area is a little weak but I don't really think the pool is a big draw in Laughlin so it does the job. There is an outlet mall and a movie theater right across the street so if you want to shop or see a movie during your trip, this is the closest place to stay. I am totally coming back to Laughlin again and though I will probably try out Harrah's next time because of their comps, I would stay here again to be in the mix of things.
reviews.title: awesome girls' weekend hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 11 nights in June, our 6th time to Laughlin. Bit apprehensive as have always stayed at our old favourite The Edgewater next door! In Sept 2007 though, we were a tad sad that Edgewater was looking very tatty & ragged, both in the rooms & the casino. They also didn't care that we had always stayed with them & wouldn't do us ANY type of deal?! We got to the Aquarius after being awake for 24 hours, looong journey. The Valets were wonderful, as was the Bell, Johnny, & the reception staff. The room was very stylish, clean & welcoming. The Casino was good, the Windows on the River Buffet was great for Champagne Brunch & all the staff in there so friendly. We had a great 12 days, we love love love Laughlin, and now we LOVE the Aquarius too. WE WILL BE BACK!!!
reviews.title: Loved The Aquarius!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great rooms, pleasant staff, excellent servuce and friendliness in cafe and buffet. Remodel on rooms is a plus; the beds are"wonderful" Clean rooms good food and a casino with variety.
reviews.title: upscale for Laughlin!
wonderful weekend!
reviews.text: We have been to Laughlin many times, and usually stay at the Colorado Belle, but the last few times we stayed there the rooms were really gross...so we said 'never again' and moved next door to the Aquarius - what a change!! We absolutely loved the Aquarius and will definitely stay there again. Beautiful rooms, with a great view of the river - everything was clean and fresh! The buffet is just OK for breakfast, but loved the Friday night seafood buffet. The swimming pool is chilled, which feels great when it is 110 outside! They have a poolside bar with $5.00 drinks, and cabanas, as well as shade covered areas with plenty of lounge chairs. The casino is bright and not overly smoky - they have a nice non-smoking section as well, but even where the smokers are is not bad at all. We are going back in September and will stay there again and recommend it to everyone!

This was the first time I have stayed in the Aquarius since they renovated their rooms, and I will say I was very happy with it. The last time I had stayed at the property was while it was still the Flamingo and it was beginning to look worn. You can see that everything was upgraded and looks much fresher.
reviews.title: May now be the best hotel in Laughlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property was built in the late 80's (or possibly very early 1990's), and this is still apparent in the layout. The rooms are on the small side, and the only problem I can see some people having is if you are multiple people sharing a room. Especially if you have a need for a lot of bathroom counter space. That is the one thing that can be a dissatisfier...though the bathroom looks nice, the counter space is the most limited I've seen in a long time.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations across the board.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other dissatisfier is the wifi. If you go and get a really good rate (I paid $30), the fact that they want $12 per day for internet is a bit outrageous. This is nearly half the room rate.
reviews.title: Excellent Value
Best hotel there
reviews.text: Staff extremenly friendly and helpful, Room was clean and bright, Bed was very comfortable and quiet. We had an adjopining room door, so we could hear the guest next door, but barely. The food in the Cafe was very good and reasonable, with lots of choices. The buffet was cruise ship quality, and very organized. They could use a second toaster though. We ate at Outback as well and were equally impressed. Casino was clean and spacious, and slots were not stingy, smke smell was hardly noticed unless you were next to a smoker, and there are no-smoking sections. Parking was not a problem all weekend. Those that rate this poorly have to ask themselves what they would pay for the same place in Las Vegas. We stayed at the Edgewater last time in Laughlin, and that place is a dump compared to this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aquarius for 7 days total with a short, one night, trip to Vegas spliting up the stay. The rooms are beautiful, large with beds that are as comfortable as any you will find anywhere. The prices for the stay were exceptional value as were the prices in the restaurants. We found the staff friendly, helpful and efficient. My only issue was with some children staying in the "adults only" tower. The Aquarius is clean, fresh and very comfortable. Laughin isn't Vegas for sure. It's sane, relaxing and far less expensive. The slots are looser and the poker games are softer. We can't wait to come back
reviews.title: Maximal Rudeness

reviews.text: I like this casino better than any other in Laughlin. I usually do my gambling here even when I stay somewhere else. There seems to be more tables and machines here and the floorplan makes sense.
reviews.title: My favorite Casino in Laughlin
Flaming hole with a side of Cockroaches
reviews.text: The rooms are typical for Laughlin. I don't eat here though. When I stay at the Flamingo I always eat next door at the Edgewater.

One problem - not enough elevators. This is especially bad if you try go downstairs at checkout time. I was stuck on my floor for about an hour because every elevator that came along was completly packed.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: Here is a plus: the covered parking lot is closer to the hotel than any other hotel in Laughlin. Some hotels make you take a major hike to get from your car to the hotel. This can be bad if you are here in summer when temperatures are over 110 degrees. The Flamino's parking garage is just a few feet from the hotel.
reviews.title: Dirty Bird !!!
Great hotel for little money
reviews.text: We had a luxury suite for the five of us. The suite itself was nice enough. The rug was a bit dirty (you could tell after walking around in white socks) and other room amenities for the price were satisfactory. You’ll be spending approximately $170 a night. You get a mini refrigerator, sink, bar, dining area, spacious living room and decent size bedroom. Slightly worn but decent. I was disturbed over what I saw downstairs. I don’t remember the specific name of the bar, however, we sat to drink and play video poker. Everything going as expected until I looked over at the condiment dispenser and saw cockroaches going in and out. FREAKED ME OUT!!! I’m sure all these places have them to some degree, however, I’m not used to this and was disgusted. We are going back to Laughlin next week, and this time plan on staying at the River Palms. Again we are getting a luxury suite for $170 a night except rather than a one bedroom suite we get a two bedroom suite. I'll write my review for them when I return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So when planning a trip to Laughlin you have to realize that there is no Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton. Laughlin doesn't pretend to be that city. It's a place on the Colorado river that attracts people that want to play all day on the river and then party, just a little, at night. And then of course there are the seniors that want the warm weather and great mid-week deals.
reviews.title: Nice Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you understand this then you should have a good time.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Laughlin Bar None!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Aquarius this weekend and it was exactly as expected...empty duirng the day, busy from about 8pm until midnight, then totally dead.
reviews.title: Mediocre food and casino. Rooms OK
This city " Laughlin" is boring.
reviews.text: The renovated rooms are nice and worth the $59.99 we paid. The $9.99 buffet was just that and the casino was generic casino fun. There is nothing here to wow you but it is a nice weekend get-away. If you want exciting pool action, this is not the place. In my opinion, Harrah's Laughlin does this a little better. Still not up to Vegas standards but this isn't Vegas.
Every employee we encountered did their job as expected. Once again, no big wow factor here.
reviews.title: Not a Great Impression. Don't Expect Luxury. But Cheap. Ignore the Bugs.
Way Past Its' Prime
reviews.text: If there was a rating somewhere between terrible and okay I would check that. Seriously doubt that we would ever go back....rooms were dirty with no clock/clock radio...the breakfast buffet hostesses were like the gestapo ordering people where or where not to sit...kids running rampant and unsupervised....no towels available at the pool with the following staff excuses(on Sunday-"we didn't get a delivery because it was Sunday"...on Monday at 3:30 P.M.-"we didn't get our delivery yet")..at the pool, there is an apparent employee...male, hispanic, heavyset, with radio hanging from his pants pocket, who must think he's a playboy, because all he does is walk around where any female is, and starts up some type of conversation...the casino area was quite dirty(must be cutting back on staff) with ash trays overflowing, and just ggenerally dirty....and again kids running all over with little or no supervision....sorry to be so negative, but I just call them like I see them!!!!!!!

reviews.title: Nice but getting old
reviews.text: We stayed here from 6/15 to 6/19/05. Had a nice standard room with King bed. We did not have a view but the price was very cheap, so no complaints there. The staff was friendly and room was clean. We ate at the Buffet and the diner and both were excellent. The only complaint was the pool. Its on the 3 floor and no greenery to cool off the area. The building itself is looking old. I would stay here again for the right price.

reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Flamingo Hotel in Lauglin June 11-14, 2005. When I made the reservations, I did so with some trepidation, because so many had written reviews that were so negative. My wife and I are pleased to report that we were happily surprised to find the hotel such a good venue. The casino is spacious and accommodating. We especially liked the designated non-smoking areas. The only real complaint we had was that the bartenders really didn't care one way or another. They are not accommodating at all! I am a business consultant of 25 years, and if it were my hotel, I would fire everyone of them. After having said that, I want to make it clear that our stay was most enjoyable, and we will return soon--but we will limit our use of the bars/lounges of the casino.
Drs. Wendell & Grace Fountain
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else
Stay Somewhere Else!
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on Memorial day weekend and we did not have very good time. Too many children and families stay in this hotel (may be due to special promotions) than any other hotel in Laughlin. Due to this, hotel was very crowded and there were long lines everywhere. Swimming pool was packed and dirty and we could not use it. This caused lot of inconveniences to all of us in our party and we feel we should not stay at Flamingo Laughlin in future and look for hotel which is adult oriented like Harrah's

reviews.title: Watch Out For Rose.....
reviews.text: OK, I won't talk about the dirty rooms with the great view. $25 a night.....you get what you pay for...and the view alone is worth staying in a dirty room. This is a tale about the "Check In Experience." If I can spare one unsuspecting traveler the pain, this post will be worth it....

reviews.title: Flamingo, Never again!
reviews.text: My brother and I arrived at check in and waited 45 minutes. We were finally greeted by Rose. The standard check in talk ensued and then the small talk started. Jokes about people in line....laughs about losing our money in the casino....talking about the heat. It was at that time that Rose was soooooo impressed with us that she decided to magically "UPGRADE" our rooms for us. You gentlemen will be staying in the "Flamingo Rooms" she said. The Flamingo Rooms? Sweet!
WOW!!!! How nice of you Rose, we said....THANK YOU SO MUCH.
reviews.title: Don't ever have an event at the Flamingo
You can't check in without your husband!
reviews.text: All of a sudden we imagined ourselves living the good life in the best rooms in town. Bathing in the jacuzzi, inviting friends over to hang in our living room, enjoying high speed access. It was going to be great!!!! All because of you Rose.....
And then it happened...And I have to bet that this was not the first time this scam has occurred. I CAN ACCEPT TIPS, she says.....
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

description: If you haven't seen the newly renovated rooms here, check out this photo of our "Luxury" room. This is a standard room, and costs just $20 more than one of the rooms that is not renovated yet. All 1907 rooms will be completely renovated this Fall (one entire tower will be complete by the end of June, 2008). Like we've been saying...it's the "New Laughlin"...come check us out!
